entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 6:11 PM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Current Conditions: Light Rain, 0.1°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 8:26 PM NST Saturday 24 December 2022
Condition: Light Rain
Temperature: 0.1°C
Pressure: 100.4 kPa
Visibility: 3.2 km
Humidity: 95 %
Dewpoint: -0.6°C
Wind: SE 35 km/h gust 58 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: N/A

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow mixed with ice pellets. Temperature rising to plus 1 this evening then falling.
entry.summary: Snow at times mixed with ice pellets ending near midnight then partly cloudy. Local blowing snow early this evening. Snow and ice pellet amount 5 cm. Wind southeast 50 km/h gusting to 80 becoming southwest 20 gusting to 40 near midnight. Temperature rising to plus 1 this evening then falling. Wind chill minus 10 this evening. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Sunday: Chance of flurries. High zero. POP 60%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud. 60 percent chance of flurries in the afternoon. Wind southwest 20 km/h. High zero. Wind chill minus 9 in the morning. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Sunday night: Chance of flurries. Low minus 8 except minus 12 in low lying inland areas. POP 60%
entry.summary: Partly cloudy. 60 percent chance of flurries in the evening. Wind southwest 20 km/h gusting to 40. Low minus 8 except minus 12 in low lying inland areas. Wind chill minus 8 in the evening and minus 15 overnight. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 24 December 2022
